titleStmt.title: By the King whereas wee are giuen to vnderstand, that the Lady Arbella [sic] and William Seymour ... being for diuers great and hainous offenses, committed, the one to our tower of London, and the other to a speciall guard
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1603-1625 : James I)
James I, King of England, 1566-1625.

publicationStmt.publisher: By Robert Barker, Printer to the Kings most Excellent Maiestie,

notesStmt.note: Other title information from first 5 lines of title.
"Giuen at Our Mannour of Greenewich the fourth day of Iune, in the ninth yeere of Our Reigne of Great Britaine, France and Ireland."
Reproduction of original in: Harvard University. Library.
